alert.note: Alert for North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 2:46AM PDT until July 16 at 4:00AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...KING TIDES WILL CAUSE MINOR COASTAL FLOODING AT LOW LYING SPOTS DURING HIGH TIDE EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... .The highest astronomical tides of the year, commonly referred to as the King Tides, have impacted the coast and bayshore this past week. Though the peek was Thursday morning localized flooding of specific low lying areas is still possible early Saturday morning during high tide. In addition, the lowest low tides of the event will be observed during later Saturday morning which may lead to trouble for mariners navigating shallow waterways. ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding expected at prone low lying coastal locations across the San Francisco Bay shoreline during peak high tide tonight. * WHERE...Low lying portions of the San Francisco Bayshore. Localized impacts are also possible in low lying areas along the Pacific shore as well. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 4 AM PDT Saturday. Please refer to local tidal data forecasts available for several coastal and bayshore locations at www.tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov. * IMPACTS...Flooding of areas previously impacted by King Tide events is expected, including low lying lots, parks, and roads throughout the San Francisco Bay Shoreline with the highest high tides. Difficulty navigating shallow bay waters during the lowest low tides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tidal levels will also rise along the Pacific coast but impacts will be more localized to areas along the SF Bay shoreline. Tide poolers and beachgoers should be familiar with the times and heights of local tidal levels to avoid hazards that may arise from rapidly shifting water levels.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
